meanings.definition: A soft-bodied invertebrate animal with a muscular foot, a mantle, and a shell.
meanings.sent1: The mollusks in the ocean have shells to protect themselves.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study different types of mollusks to learn about their habitats.
meanings.sent3: The mollusks had a race to see who could crawl the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the diverse shapes of mollusks in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the colorful mollusks at the aquarium.

meanings.definition: Any member of the phylum Mollusca, including snails, slugs, octopuses, and squids.
meanings.sent1: Mollusks like snails and squids are part of the same group.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium had a special exhibit featuring various mollusks.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious dish using mollusks as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, the garden was filled with giant mollusks roaming around.
meanings.sent5: The diver marveled at the beauty of the underwater world filled with colorful mollusks.
